alert.note: Alert for Antelope Valley; Los Angeles County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 11 at 2:26PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Significant flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible, especially in and near recent burn areas. * WHERE...Antelope Valley and interior Los Angeles County Mountains (excluding the Santa Monica Range). This includes the Bobcat burn scar. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Slow moving showers and thunderstorms may produce heavy downpours to around 1.00 inch per hour. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding and near recent burn areas should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Antelope Valley; Los Angeles County Mountains
